Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The cyclotides are head-to-tail macrocyclic and they have three disulfides arranged in a cystine knot, in which two disulfide bonds and their connecting backbone segments form an embedded ring that is penetrated by the third disulfide bond. Cyclotides exhibit a broad range of biological effects, including insecticidal, haemolytic, and cytotoxic effects.
Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism and shows potent cytotoxic activity.
Sequence Information.PTM: Contains three disulfide bonds 5-19; 9-21; 14-26. This is a cyclic peptide (cross-link between G1-N29).

Literature.Title: The alpine violet, Viola biflora, is a rich source of cyclotides with potent cytotoxicity.
Literature.Author: Herrmann A, Burman R, Mylne JS, Karlsson G, Gullbo J, Craik DJ, Clark RJ, GÃ¶ransson U.
